title: Completed PE Summary - Etoile Des Ondes
raw_html:
Category Fishing
Registered Owner & Manager: Mr Robert Simmonds
Port of registry: Weymouth
Flag: UK
Type: Potter
Built: 1957
Construction: Wood
Length overall: 14.5m
Gross tonnage: 40.00
Date & Time 21/05/05 09:55
Location of incident: Foriegn high seas
Incident Type: Accident to Person
Persons onboard: 4 crew
Injuries/ fatalities: 1 fatality
Damage/ Pollution: None

Synopsis

Shortly after a string of pots had been shot from this 14.5 metre long potter, a crewman was noticed to be missing. After a quick search of the vessel it was concluded he had fallen overboard. A large search and rescue operation by French and UK aircraft and surface vessels failed to find him.

Action taken:

The Chief Inspector of Marine accidents has written to the vessel's owner and skipper, recommending that they:

  • re-examine operational aspects of the vessel with aim of reducing the chances of crew falling overboard

  • encourage the wearing of permanent wear buoyancy aids or lifejackets by crew working on deck
